main event: A bright light of variable brilliance was observed hovering in the vicinity of Ottawa, Ohio, on April 6, 1958.
interesting points: The object changed size from a pinhead to the size of a quarter while pulsating., The object was described as possibly balloon-like in motion., It moved in a south to north direction., Witnesses reported that the object was brighter than stars and changed color during observation., The Air Force could not identify the object after investigation.
sighted object: a bright light, elongated in shape
witness description: local residents observing the object with the naked eye
